function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Failure to consider smaller areas immediately around where people live and are exposed may limit the accuracy of the findings.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of the relationship between COVID-19 fatality rates and built/natural environment features.","Mitigation":"Conduct additional studies that focus on smaller geographic units to capture micro-level variations in the built and natural environment.","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping tools for detailed analysis of localized environmental features.","People":"Resident populations in areas with varied built and natural environment features.","Owner":"Researchers, local health departments, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Exclusion of potentially important variables such as air pollution and wind speed may lead to incomplete understanding of COVID-19 spread.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of the factors influencing COVID-19 mortality rates.","Mitigation":"Incorporate air pollution and wind speed data into the analysis to assess their impact on COVID-19 spread and mortality rates.","Technologies":"Air pollution monitoring sensors, weather data collection systems, and statistical modeling tools.","People":"Population residing in areas with varying levels of air pollution and wind speed.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, public health organizations, and researchers."},{"Description":"Inability to make causal inferences due to the correlational nature of the study may limit the ability to identify direct causes of COVID-19 mortality rates.","Impact":"Inability to determine the direct causal factors contributing to COVID-19 mortality.","Mitigation":"Conduct longitudinal studies and experimental research to establish causal relationships between environmental factors and COVID-19 mortality rates.","Technologies":"Long-term data collection systems, experimental study methodologies, and causal inference modeling techniques.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, and funding organizations."}]}
